I see. Well i don't play ranked so I wouldn't know. Every champ feels different depending on how good everyone is individually. He ain't an assassin.

He sure as hell *looks* like one, but he isn't.

An assassin is defined by the following pattern:

* Go in
* Kill a priority target
* Get out

Strictly speaking, Pyke follows that pattern, but there's a crucial difference between Pyke and other Assassins.

If a Zed wants somebody dead, he goes in and kills them.

Same for Talon, Rengar, Kha, Leblanc, Fizz, you name it. They're all pretty independent of their teams.

Pyke, on the other hand, can't do that. Pyke can't solo kill. 
He can mop up once his team does some heavy lifting, but if a Pyke is tasked with killing somebody on his own he's just going to fail unless his target is behind.
the problem, is : he is and : he can

If he's fed and his victims are a lower level, sure he can go in and instagib that 2/5/3 Ashe.

That's not just Pyke, though. That's most champions.

Throw a Bard in that same situation and I can tell you for a fact that he can walk up whenever he wants and slap the shit out of that poor ADC.
the thing is. he does not need to be that fed. he can kill a fed adc with 2 kills if he killed with his ult.

The things I have always wanted to see changed on him:

 - Narrower hook. It has a bad case of the Thresh where the physical hook is smaller than the hitbox. This would invite more skill to be placed in the skillshot.
 - Remove the slow on his hook. This is the reason that it's impossible to dodge his E without a dash or a blink. This invites more skill with the "aiming" mechanic of moving around after the dash but before the stun.
 - Revert the buffs to his gold generation. Riot wants him to be a support, then gives him the chance to come out of a solo kill with 600 gold like that makes any sense.
 - Reduce the amount of gray health he gets from being damaged. I'm personally fine with the "go invis and heal" thing because you just have to ward bushes and use gap close more carefully when you want to fight him. Also grievous wounds is extra good on him because he doesn't usually build Spirit Visage.
